diff_user.system:
You are an expert data engineer specializing in converting data to text. Your task is to create a Python program that converts a list of triples into natural language text. The given triples will be associated with the topic: CelestialBody. The program should implement a function called 'predict' that accepts a list of triples and generates a coherent, contextually relevant sentence that accurately represents the information contained in the triples. Ensure that the generated text is fluent, grammatically correct, and maintains the meaning of the original data. There can be multiple triples given that make up a complex sentence. Converting all those triples into one sentence will award greater score. An example of a complex sentence:
Triples:
(Antwerp | cityServed | Antwerp International Airport)
(Belgium | country | Antwerp)
(City of Brussels | capital | Belgium)
Example sentence:
"Antwerp International Airport serves the city of Antwerp which is in Belgium, where the capital is Brussels."

The 'predict' function returns that sentence as a string. Below is the list of all possible predicates that can be given as an input. With the given predicates and example triples implement the 'predict' function so it can process all the possible predicates:

Predicate: apoapsis - Example triple: ((15788) 1993 SB | apoapsis | 7715100000.0 (kilometres))
Predicate: discoverer - Example triple: ((15788) 1993 SB | discoverer | Alan Fitzsimmons)
Predicate: epoch - Example triple: ((15788) 1993 SB | epoch | 2006-03-06)
Predicate: orbitalPeriod - Example triple: ((15788) 1993 SB | orbitalPeriod | 7729430000.0)
Predicate: periapsis - Example triple: ((15788) 1993 SB | periapsis | 3997100000000.0)
Predicate: averageSpeed - Example triple: ((19255) 1994 VK8 | averageSpeed | 4.56 (kilometrePerSeconds))
Predicate: escapeVelocity - Example triple: ((19255) 1994 VK8 | escapeVelocity | 0.0925 (kilometrePerSeconds))
Predicate: mass - Example triple: ((19255) 1994 VK8 | mass | 5.6 (kilograms))
Predicate: temperature - Example triple: ((19255) 1994 VK8 | temperature | 43.0 (kelvins))
Predicate: density - Example triple: ((29075) 1950 DA | density | 3.5 (kilograms))
Predicate: rotationPeriod - Example triple: ((29075) 1950 DA | rotationPeriod | 7637.76)
Predicate: maximumTemperature - Example triple: ((410777) 2009 FD | maximumTemperature | 362.0 (kelvins))
Predicate: meanTemperature - Example triple: ((410777) 2009 FD | meanTemperature | 258.0 (kelvins))
Predicate: minimumTemperature - Example triple: ((410777) 2009 FD | minimumTemperature | 211.0 (kelvins))
Predicate: formerName - Example triple: ((66063) 1998 RO1 | formerName | "1999 SN5")
Predicate: absoluteMagnitude - Example triple: (1001 Gaussia | absoluteMagnitude | 9.7)
Predicate: discovered - Example triple: (101 Helena | discovered | 1868-08-15)
Predicate: surfaceArea - Example triple: (10 Hygiea | surfaceArea | 837080.744 (squareKilometres))
Predicate: deathCause - Example triple: (James Craig Watson | deathCause | Peritonitis)
Predicate: deathPlace - Example triple: (James Craig Watson | deathPlace | Madison, Wisconsin)
Predicate: nationality - Example triple: (James Craig Watson | nationality | Canada)
Predicate: stateOfOrigin - Example triple: (James Craig Watson | stateOfOrigin | Canada)
Predicate: almaMater - Example triple: (Walter Baade | almaMater | University of Göttingen)
Predicate: birthPlace - Example triple: (Walter Baade | birthPlace | German Empire)
Predicate: doctoralStudent - Example triple: (Walter Baade | doctoralStudent | Allan Sandage)
Predicate: deathDate - Example triple: (Grigory Neujmin | deathDate | 1946-12-17)
Predicate: birthDate - Example triple: (Grigory Neujmin | birthDate | 1886-01-01)

class Triple:
    subject: str
